com.anji.integration
Interface Activator

All Superinterfaces:
XmlPersistable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AnjiActivator, BainNN, GridNet, NNAdaptor
public interface Activator
extends XmlPersistable

Although any object taking and returning double arrays can implement this, it is meant to be a simple neural net interface where the arrays are input and output activation patterns.

Author:
Philip Tucker

next

java.lang.Object next()

Object output array of type double with dimensions dependent on implementation, given last provided input activation via nextSequence(double[]) or nextSequence(double[][]).

getInputDimension

int[] getInputDimension()
Returns:
dimension(s) of input array. If the input array is a single dimension vector then the returned array will have length 1; in general the returned array will have as many elements as there are dimensions in the input vector.

getOutputDimension

int[] getOutputDimension()
Returns:
dimension(s) of output array. If the output array is a single dimension vector then the returned array will have length 1; in general the returned array will have as many elements as there are dimensions in the output vector.

getInputCount

int getInputCount()
Returns:
the total number of inputs.

getOutputCount

int getOutputCount()
Returns:
the total number of outputs.

render

boolean render(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
               int width,
               int height,
               int neuronSize)
Renders this network as an image.

Parameters:
g - the graphics object to render the network to.
width - The desired width in pixels of the rendering.
height - The desired height in pixels of the rendering.
neuronSize - The desired size in pixels of the neurons.
Returns:
true iff successful, false otherwise.

dispose

void dispose()
Release any resources associated with this Activator.

isRecurrent

boolean isRecurrent()
Returns true iff the topology of the network has recurrent connections.
